alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 7:32PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cheyenne County in northwestern Kansas and south central Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska through 700 PM MDT/800 PM CDT/... At 632 PM MDT/732 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of St. Francis, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Cheyenne County in northwestern Kansas and south central Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska, including the following locations... Wheeler. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
